channel.title: Hosting server from CPU help
channel.description:
Hello Im having troubles with the ips that i have to put in the Client to host off my computer... i have mine alll set up to 127.0.0.1 and then i have to make a seperate client the exactly same to send to my friends to host it... can someone help me what i have to put into the release client so my friends can play with me please? Much apprecaited! Thanks
Blackpanther0928

item.title: Hosting server from CPU help
item.dc:creator: @blackpanther0928 blackpanther0928
item.description:
@blackpanther0928 wrote:

okay so i changed the release client to elite-xile.no-ip.org…

do i have to change the GUI 127.0.0.1 to elite-xile.no-ip.org as well?

i just also sent it to my friend to see if he could log on… and he couldnt log on… could someone please help me it should take no time at all please! =[ i have TV so you can show me step by step or atleast tell me… and i can do it… i just want you to see… and i also get another error… idk what it is when i run it… when it pops up this shows up with it…

elite-xile is loading.. java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\insidiaXV8cache\Maps\mapConfig.txt (The system cannot find the file specified) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileReader.<init>(Unknown Source) at client.setNewMaps(client.java:111) at client.startUp(client.java:9047) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6073) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Loaded 525 graphics... Loaded Compressed Models.. Loading animations Loaded the flo. 602 NPC Amount: 11257 The Item List is loading...

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting server from CPU help
item.dc:creator: @velosofy velosofy
item.description:
@velosofy wrote:

Hamachi sucks, just portforward.
Go to cmd: type ipconfig
take the standard gateway ip and paste it in a webbrowser
u will connect to your router
the name and pw are mostly admin, admin, if not search on google for routerpasswords.
then find ports and open 43594-43594.
then make a no-ip
and put that ip in ur client where the 127.0.0… is
then run it and ur done

Read full topic

item.title: Hosting server from CPU help
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

You have to put the IP of the computer that you are hosting it on in the release client.
You may also need to portforward and turn your firewall off.

If you are only going to play with friend, I recommend Hamachi to save you the trouble.
Setup a network on Hamachi, put your hamachi IP into the client, compile, and send it to them. They also have to join your hamachi network to be able to join.

Read full topic
